alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Lamb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bailey and southwestern Lamb Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 715 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Enochs, or 12 miles north of Morton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Needmore, Enochs, Muleshoe Wildlife Refuge and Bula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
